programme.desc: Toni Collette, Hugo Weaving, Levi Miller, Angourie Rice, Dan Wyllie and Aaron McGrath star in the story of Charlie Bucktin, a bookish boy of 14 living in a small town in Western Australia. In the dead of night during the scorching summer of 1969, Charlie is startled when he is woken by local mixed-race outcast Jasper Jones outside his window. Jasper leads him deep into the forest and shows him something that will change his life forever, setting them both on a dangerous journey to solve a mystery that will consume the entire community.

programme.title: Lucky Break
programme.desc: Peter Cattaneo ("The Full Monty") directs this British comedy starring James Nesbitt as Jimmy Hands, a raffish robber assigned to a grim correctional facility. When the prison's governor (Christopher Plummer) is persuaded to stage a production of a misguided musical based on the story of Admiral Nelson and Lady Emma Hamilton, Jimmy and his buddies seize the opportunity to plan a jailbreak. However, complicating matters is a lovely therapist (Olivia Williams), who, cast as Jimmy's costar, steals his heart. Timothy Spall and Lennie James costar.

programme.title: London Town
programme.desc: When fifteen-year-old Shay (Daniel Huttlestone) hears the music of The Clash for the first time, it's a revelation, opening up a new world of anti-establishment defiance beyond anything he's known in his dead-end London suburb. Drawn into the heart of the city's burgeoning punk scene, he forges two relationships that will change his life: falling in love with rebellious cool girl Vivian (Nell Williams) and finding an unexpected connection with none other than The Clash's electrifying frontman, Joe Strummer (Jonathan Rhys Meyers).

programme.title: Killshot
programme.desc: An innocent couple that crosses paths with a professional assassin is forced into the witness protection program while the resourceful killer hunts them down in this crime thriller starring Diane Lane, Mickey Rourke and Thomas Jane.

programme.title: Blackway
programme.desc: Revenge thriller starring Anthony Hopkins as a man haunted by the memory of his daughter's death, who comes to the aid of a young woman who is being viciously harassed by a rogue cop. Co-stars Julia Stiles and Ray Liotta.

programme.title: Lost Cat Corona
programme.desc: Dominic likes to play it safe, but Dom's M.O. is tested when his wife's cat goes missing and he sets out on a quest to find him. Over the course of one day, Dom endures neighborhood mayhem at every turn. He meets a deranged psychopath, endures a sideshow of a wake, and becomes unwittingly involved in the exchange of illegal knockoff handbags. As the day nears the end, a confrontation with a pair of badass teens forces Dom to face the issues that have been holding him hostage his entire life.

programme.title: Fair Haven
programme.desc: A young piano prodigy returns to his family farm, after a long stay in a gay conversion therapy, and is torn between the expectations of his emotionally distant father and the memory of a past, loving relationship he's tried to bury.

programme.title: Wakefield
programme.desc: Successful suburbanite commuter Howard Wakefield (Bryan Cranston) takes a perverse detour from family life by vanishing without a trace. Hidden in the attic of his carriage house garage and surviving by scavenging at night, Howard secretly observes the lives of his wife (Jennifer Garner) and children and neighbors. He slowly realizes that he has not left his family, he has left himself.

programme.title: The Light Between Oceans
programme.desc: Lighthouse keeper Tom Sherbourne (Michael Fassbender) and spirited Isabel (Alicia Vikander) live together in married bliss on a remote, rugged island off the coast of Australia. But their windswept world is turned upside down when Isabel learns that she's unable to bear a child. One day, a drifting lifeboat washes ashore with a crying baby in it. The dilemma the couple now faces echoes far beyond the island, engulfing and irrevocably impacting their world.

programme.title: Yes
programme.desc: In the Season 2 premiere, a shocking event in the Gregsons' neighborhood changes their lives and opens their door on Tara's family secrets.(c)

programme.title: Trouble Junction
programme.desc: Tara realizes that her "alters" are showing up again but keeps her condition a secret; Max decides to renovate the house they have inherited and flip it; a newly engaged Charmaine asks to move in with the Gregsons; Marshall dates a girl.(c)

programme.title: Joan Rivers: A Piece of Work
programme.desc: This insightful, hysterically funny documentary follows comedienne Joan Rivers through a year of her life while looking back on her groundbreaking, barrier-breaking career as one of the first women to make a name for herself in the tough, male-dominated world of show business.

programme.title: Personal Shopper
programme.desc: By day, American in Paris Maureen (Kristen Stewart) works as a personal shopper, motor-biking around the city buying up deluxe couture for a celebrity client. By night, she attempts to channel the spirits of the dead, hoping to make contact with her recently deceased twin brother. When Maureen begins receiving a series of chilling, increasingly sinister text messages, it seems she may have made contact - but she doesn't know with whom.

programme.title: Sleepless
programme.desc: When Las Vegas cop Vincent Downs (Jamie Foxx) and his partner Sean (Tip "T.I." Harris) rob a cocaine shipment bound for a drug-dealing casino boss (Dermot Mulroney), the desperate businessman retaliates by kidnapping Vincent's son (Octavius J. Johnson). Pursued by a dogged Internal Affairs investigator (Michelle Monaghan) and a sadistic drug kingpin (Scoot McNairy), Vincent must rely on his street smarts and sheer force of will as he tries to rescue his child over the course of a single night. Directed by Baran bo Odar.

programme.title: Wakefield
programme.desc: Successful suburbanite commuter Howard Wakefield (Bryan Cranston) takes a perverse detour from family life by vanishing without a trace. Hidden in the attic of his carriage house garage and surviving by scavenging at night, Howard secretly observes the lives of his wife (Jennifer Garner) and children and neighbors. He slowly realizes that he has not left his family, he has left himself.

programme.title: Life Is Beautiful (La vita e bella)
programme.desc: Guido is a charming, bumbling Jewish waiter whose colorful imagination and playful spirit help him to woo a beautiful schoolteacher. The couple marries and has a young son, but before long, their idyllic world is threatened by Nazi soldiers who force the family into a concentration camp. Guido must now use his imagination again - this time to transform his son's tragic new surroundings into a magical wonderland.

programme.title: Queen of the Desert
programme.desc: Gertrude Bell (Nicole Kidman) rejects the stifling rigidity of life in turn-of-the-century England, leaving it behind for a chance to travel to Tehran. She begins her lifelong adventure across the Arab world, a journey marked by danger, a passionate affair with a British officer (James Franco), and an encounter with the legendary T.E. Lawrence (Robert Pattinson).

programme.title: Dogville
programme.desc: Provocative and emotionally demanding, Lars von Trier's controversial allegory about the darker side of human nature and American arrogance has been likened to a hellish version of "Our Town." Into a small town - represented by chalk outlines and a few props - arrives a stranger (Nicole Kidman) in need of sanctuary. Initially welcoming, Dogville's citizens show their true colors once they listen to their paranoiac fears. This winner of more than 10 international awards costars Paul Bettany, James Caan, Patricia Clarkson and Lauren Bacall.

programme.title: It Stains The Sands Red
programme.desc: In the throes of a zombie apocalypse, Molly - a troubled woman from Las Vegas with a dark past - finds herself stranded in the desert with a ravenous zombie on her tail. At first, she's easily able to outpace her undead pursuer, but things quickly become worse when she realizes the zombie doesn't need to ever stop and rest. Running low on supplies and beat down by the harsh environment, Molly must summon strength she never knew she had in order to face it.

programme.title: Bang Bang Baby
programme.desc: In this dreamy sci-fi musical set in the 1960s, an isolated small town teenager believes her hopes of becoming a famous singer will come true when her rock star idol gets stranded in town and romance blooms between them but a leak in a nearby chemical plant threatens to turn her dream into a nightmare.

programme.title: Different Flowers
programme.desc: Uptight Millie Haven (Emma Bell) has always followed the rules, but when she has doubts before her big Kansas City wedding, her attitude-prone little sister Emma (Hope Lauren), comes to the rescue. They embark on a spontaneous road trip to their grandmother's farm where, with the help of Grandma Mildred (Shelley Long), they rediscover their bond. They meet a local hunk with a heart of gold, and a host of only-in-the-Midwest characters as they pick up the pieces of Millie's life.

programme.title: You, Me and Him
programme.desc: Two female lovers, one a career driven lawyer (Lucy Punch), the other a fun-loving, pot-smoking layabout (Faye Marsay), have an annoying Casanova neighbor (David Tennant). While neither woman ever wanted children, both end up pregnant, creating conflicts that cause each to re-examine their outlook on life and their relationship.

programme.title: JIMI: All Is By My Side
programme.desc: André Benjamin stars as Jimi Hendrix in this revealing biopic from writer-director John Ridley ('12 Years A Slave'). Covering a transformative year in Hendrix's life from 1966-67, in which he went from a New York City backing musician to making his mark in London's music scene up until his Monterey Pop triumph, the film presents an intimate portrait of the sensitive young musician on the verge of becoming a rock legend.

programme.title: The Truth Hurts
programme.desc: The truth emerges about Tara's alters, one of whom brings out a new side of Max; Neil finds out about Charmaine's engagement; Kate grows closer to Lynda, an older woman; Marshall and his girlfriend Courtney begin to experiment.(c)

programme.title: You Becoming You
programme.desc: Tara seeks a new therapist as a new alter emerges; Max struggles with the infidelity committed by Buck; Charmaine has big news for the family; Tara and Max disapprove of Kate's friendship with Lynda.(c)

credits.director: Graphic Language, Adult Content, Brief Nudity

programme.title: Bad Grandmas
programme.desc: Senior citizens Mimi, Bobbi, Virginia and Coralee quietly live out their twilight years in Southern Missouri playing cards and baking cakes. Bobbi's son-in-law, Jim, cons her into losing her house and Mimi, the unofficial leader of the group, decides to take matters into her own hands. Things spin out of control when she confronts Jim and he accidentally gets killed in the altercation.

programme.title: Certain Women
programme.desc: Michelle Williams, Kristen Stewart and Laura Dern star as three women striving to forge their own paths amidst the wide-open plains of the American Northwest. The lawyer (Dern) finds herself contending with both office sexism and a hostage situation. The wife and mother (Williams) has determination to build her dream home which puts her at odds with the men in her life. The young law student (Stewart) forms an ambiguous bond with a lonely ranch hand (Lily Gladstone).

programme.title: Different Flowers
programme.desc: Uptight Millie Haven (Emma Bell) has always followed the rules, but when she has doubts before her big Kansas City wedding, her attitude-prone little sister Emma (Hope Lauren), comes to the rescue. They embark on a spontaneous road trip to their grandmother's farm where, with the help of Grandma Mildred (Shelley Long), they rediscover their bond. They meet a local hunk with a heart of gold, and a host of only-in-the-Midwest characters as they pick up the pieces of Millie's life.

programme.title: Vicky Cristina Barcelona
programme.desc: Romantic comedy-drama about a pair of American friends (Scarlett Johansson and Rebecca Hall) who vacation together in Spain and fall under the romantic spell of Juan, a passionate artist (Javier Bardem).

programme.title: The Hundred-Foot Journey
programme.desc: When a displaced Indian family opens a restaurant in the south of France, just 100 feet from a Michelin star restaurant, a culinary war ensues between the two establishments. Stars Academy Award® winner Helen Mirren.(n)

programme.title: Mistrust
programme.desc: Happy, beautiful and independent, Veronica enjoys being a mistress. No commitment, no strings and she never has to be vulnerable. She has carefully laid every brick in the walls of the fortress surrounding her heart. She's safe and having a great time. However, there is one person who knew her heart before those walls were erected, her best friend Brandon, who has stood by her for too many years to count. And while Veronica has tried to keep her feelings at bay, he is the one who holds the key that opens her Pandora's box of emotions.(n)

programme.title: Bad Grandmas
programme.desc: Senior citizens Mimi, Bobbi, Virginia and Coralee quietly live out their twilight years in Southern Missouri playing cards and baking cakes. Bobbi's son-in-law, Jim, cons her into losing her house and Mimi, the unofficial leader of the group, decides to take matters into her own hands. Things spin out of control when she confronts Jim and he accidentally gets killed in the altercation.(n)

programme.title: Fight Valley
programme.desc: When a young woman is found dead after getting involved in an underground fighting ring, her sister begins training under a respected ex-fighter to bring justice to the killer.(n)

programme.title: The Funhouse Massacre
programme.desc: On Halloween night, a group of notorious serial killers escape from an asylum and terrorize the patrons of a funhouse carnival - leaving only a rag-tag bunch of kids, a clueless deputy and a local sheriff to stop the carnage.(n)

programme.title: The Fantasticks
programme.desc: Joel Grey and Brad Sullivan are small-town fathers conspiring to bring their children together in a love match by pretending to discourage it in this magical musical costarring Barnard Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Prince: Sign 'o' the Times
programme.desc: This concert film features clips of live stage performances from Rotterdam and Minnesota, and is also interspersed with short films from the artist. Fan favorites, such as 'Little Red Corvette' and 'U Got the Look,' are performed as Prince is accompanied on stage by Sheena Easton and drummer Sheila E.(n)

programme.title: Tim & Faith: Soul2Soul
programme.desc: Includes live performances from Tim McGraw and Faith Hill's 2017 Soul2Soul world tour, as well as an intimate look inside their relationship. Never before seen interviews are presented along side behind-the-scenes footage, capturing their chemistry on and off the stage. Directed and executive produced by the award-winning team of Dan Cutforth and Jane Lipsitz.(n)

programme.title: Cursed to Kill
programme.desc: Rachel awakens in a hospital, paralyzed from the waist down after a failed attempt on her life for abandoning a cult suicide. Her suffering grows as the spirits of the deceased members begin to haunt her within the confines of the hospital room. They threaten to kill her unless she is willing to offer up a kindred soul in place of her own - her brother's child. But the week that Rachel is given to make her decision is tethered to a curse. All who have the misfortune of hearing anything she says are met with a swift and violent death.(n)

programme.title: More Than T
programme.desc: Beyond the headlines and debates about gender rights witness the multidimensional lives of seven transgender and gender nonconforming individuals as told through the lens of celebrated filmmaker Silas Howard (‘Transparent').(n)

programme.title: Doin' Time
programme.desc: Max's violent outburst comes back to haunt him; Tara discovers that she can remain aware of her actions when her new alter, Shoshana, takes over; Kate's music video is an Internet hit; Charmaine receives surprising news from her doctor.(n)

programme.title: Torando!
programme.desc: A tornado forces the Gregsons to take shelter in their basement, where Tara's new alter Shoshana takes charge and reveals some long-buried secrets during a group therapy session.(n)

programme.title: Behold the Monkey
programme.desc: A well-intentioned pensioner restores a fresco in a small Spanish town.(n)

programme.title: Last Girl Standing
programme.desc: Five years after surviving a brutal massacre, the lone survivor struggles to reclaim her shattered life. But just when she thinks she might finally be ready to start anew, the past comes back to haunt her.(n)

programme.title: Whale Rider
programme.desc: In a small coastal village, the Maori descend from Paikea, the Whale Rider. In every generation, a male heir has succeeded to the chiefly title. When twins are born, and the boy twin dies, the chief is unable to accept his grand-daughter, Pai, as a future leader. Koro, the chief, is convinced that the tribe's misfortunes began at Pai's birth and calls for people to bring their sons to him, sure a new leader will emerge. Pai loves Koro more than anyone in the world, but she must fight him and a thousand years of tradition to fulfill her destiny.(n)

programme.title: Jackson
programme.desc: An intimate documentary look into the lives of three women caught up in the complex issues surrounding access to reproductive healthcare in the Deep South: Shannon Brewer, director of Jackson Women's Health Organization, the only remaining abortion clinic in Mississippi; Barbara Beaver, a leader of the anti-abortion movement, who runs the Center for Pregnancy Choices; and April Jackson, a young mother of four faced with another unplanned pregnancy.(n)

programme.title: London Town
programme.desc: When fifteen-year-old Shay (Daniel Huttlestone) hears the music of The Clash for the first time, it's a revelation, opening up a new world of anti-establishment defiance beyond anything he's known in his dead-end London suburb. Drawn into the heart of the city's burgeoning punk scene, he forges two relationships that will change his life: falling in love with rebellious cool girl Vivian (Nell Williams) and finding an unexpected connection with none other than The Clash's electrifying frontman, Joe Strummer (Jonathan Rhys Meyers).(n)

programme.title: Dark Victory
programme.desc: A rich party girl is diagnosed with a potentially terminal brain tumor, driving her to an existential crisis, and the challenge of facing possible death with dignity. A Best Picture nominee, and Bette Davis was nominated for Best Actress as the ill woman. (cc).

programme.title: The Rains Came
programme.desc: India's torrential rains background the romance of a straying wife (Myrna Loy) and a Hindu physician (Tyrone Power) in this impressive version of the novel by Louis Bromfield. Tom: George Brent. Fern: Brenda Joyce. Esketh: Nigel Bruce. Phoebe: Jane Darwell. Maharani: Maria Ouspenskaya. Mrs. Simon: Marjorie Rambeau. Maharajah: H.B. Warner. Lily: Laura Hope Crews. Miss MacDaid: Mary Nash. Smiley: Henry Travers. Directed by Clarence Brown.

programme.title: 'Til We Meet Again
programme.desc: Tear-jerking shipboard romance between a dying woman and a man convicted of murder and on his way to the gallows is a remake of the 1932 hit "One Way Passage." Frank McHugh supplies comic relief as he reprises his role as a tipsy pickpocket from the original.

programme.title: Luxury Liner
programme.desc: A teenager becomes Cupid's assistant after she stows away on her father's "Love Boat"-type cruise ship, where she entertains passengers with songs while also finding herself falling for a young officer on the vessel.

programme.title: My Reputation
programme.desc: A recent widow ignores convention and defies the expectations of her family when she falls for a handsome major while on a ski trip and becomes romantically involved with him.

programme.title: Where East Is East
programme.desc: Lon Chaney as a trapper in Indo-China who struggles against the dangerous influence of his ex-wife in this silent melodrama. Directed by Tod Browning.

programme.title: The Squaw Man
programme.desc: Cecil B. DeMille's third filming of the tale of an exiled Englishman who comes to America and marries an Indian. Winifred Kingston, who starred in the 1914 silent, has a small uncredited role in this version.

programme.title: Kongo
programme.desc: Walter Huston is excellent as the maniacal ruler of a jungle empire. Tula: Lupe Velez. Ann: Virginia Bruce. Kingsland: Conrad Nagel. Gregg: C. Henry Gordon. Fuzzy: Curtis Neron. Hogan: Mitchell Lewis. Cookie: Forrester Harvey.

programme.title: Mexican Spitfire
programme.desc: The first in the series about fiery Latina entertainer Carmelita (Lupe Velez) has her recent marriage to a stuffy-but-likable American businessman threatened by interference from his wealthy, snobbish aunt.

programme.title: Mexican Spitfire Out West
programme.desc: Third entry in the series puts the fiery Latina in Las Vegas, where she is considering divorcing her straitlaced husband because she feels he's neglecting her.

programme.title: Mexican Spitfire at Sea
programme.desc: In the fourth entry in the series, the fiery Latina newlywed believes she's finally getting a honeymoon as she and her husband take a Hawaiian cruise, but she is incensed when she discovers the getaway is really a business trip during which he's hoping to bag an important client.

programme.title: Laughing Boy
programme.desc: Ramon Novarro and Lupe Velez give striking performances in this tale of a Navajo Indian and his unfaithful wide.

programme.title: Playmates
programme.desc: A washed-up Shakespearean actor cooks up a publicity scheme to break into radio by tutoring a popular Dixieland bandleader in how to perform the Bard's plays for a festival. John Barrymore's final screen appearance.

programme.title: Strictly Dynamite
programme.desc: A poet is maneuvered into writing gags for a comic. James Durante, Lupe Velez. Nick: Norman Foster. Sylvia: Marian Nixon. Sam: Eugene Pallette. Mill: Minna Gombell. Specialty: Mills Brothers. Funny. Elliott Nugent directed.

programme.title: Girl From Mexico
programme.desc: An entry in the "Mexican Spitfire" series with Lupe Velez, in which she plays a trouble-prone bombshell from south of the border who scores a hit with an ad man looking for a singer to headline his New York City radio show.

programme.title: Hot Pepper
programme.desc: Two battling ex-Marines negotiate the world of gamblers and speakeasies. A sequel to "What Price Glory.

programme.title: Honolulu Lu
programme.desc: Tired of posing as nobility to aid her uncle (Leo Carrillo), a girl (Lupe Velez) goes into burlesque and becomes a hit with the Navy. Bruce Bennett. Directed by Charles Barton.

programme.title: The Half-Naked Truth
programme.desc: The exploits of a Broadway press agent (Lee Tracy). Lupe Velez. Farrell: Frank Morgan. Achilles: Eugene Pallette. Lou: James Donlon. Munday: Robert McKenzie. Directed by Gregory LaCava.

programme.title: Ladies' Day
programme.desc: Baseball players' wives try to keep the team's star pitcher away from his bride until a pennant's won.

programme.title: High Flyers
programme.desc: Two zanies (Bert Wheeler, Robert Woolsey) become entangled in a smuggling plot. Lupe Velez. Arlene: Marjorie Lord. Dave: Jack Carson. Mrs. Arlington: Margaret Dumont. Dave: Paul Harvey. Strenuous attempt. Directed by Edward F. Cline.

programme.title: The Cuban Love Song
programme.desc: Combination of romance, comedy and music as Lawrence Tibbett and Lupe Velez costar in this tale of Marines in Cuba. Jimmy Durante, Ernest Torrence, Karen Morley, Louise Fazenda, Hale Hamilton. Directed by W.S. Van Dyke.

programme.title: The Shiralee
programme.desc: A study of an Australian swagman (Peter Finch), roving the countryside with a daughter (Dana Wilson). Marge: Elizabeth Sellars. Donny: George Rose. Lily: Rosemary Harris. Parker: Russell Napier. Bella: Tessie O'Shea. Luke: Sidney James. Beauty: Niall MacGinnis. Desmond: Reg Lye. Warm, human situations. Fine location photography; Leslie Norman directed. (cc).

programme.title: The Abdication
programme.desc: Romanticized portrait of Sweden's Queen Christina, who forsook her Protestant throne for Catholicism in 1655. Liv Ullmann, Peter Finch. Oxenstierna: Cyril Cusack. Altieri: Paul Rogers. Barberini: Graham Crowden. Directed by Anthony Harvey.

programme.title: The Abdication
programme.desc: Romanticized portrait of Sweden's Queen Christina, who forsook her Protestant throne for Catholicism in 1655. Liv Ullmann, Peter Finch. Oxenstierna: Cyril Cusack. Altieri: Paul Rogers. Barberini: Graham Crowden. Directed by Anthony Harvey.

programme.title: A Town like Alice
programme.desc: A poignant tale of prisoners (Peter Finch, Virginia McKenna) who fall in love on a forced march. Both stars won British awards. Takagi, Tran Van Khe. Jack Lee directed.

programme.title: The Legend of Lylah Clare
programme.desc: A portrait of backstage Hollywood follows an unknown actress as she re-creates the life of a late movie queen, replete with coaching by the dead woman's director-husband.

programme.title: Far from the Madding Crowd
programme.desc: Director John Schlesinger directs this version of the Thomas Hardy novel about a headstrong farm owner who must chose between her extremely different suitors.

programme.title: No Love for Johnnie
programme.desc: British politics as seen through the eyes of a House of Commons member (Peter Finch), whose domestic life influences his career. Fred: Stanley Holloway. Renfrew: Donald Pleasence. Pauline: Mary Peach. Mary: Billie Whitelaw. Johnson: Paul Rogers. Alice: Rosalie Crutchley. Ralph Thomas directed.(n)

programme.title: Girl with Green Eyes
programme.desc: A naive country girl gets a roommate with life experience when she moves into a flat in Dublin. The women meet an older writer, who is charmed by the country girl's rural ways rather than the more worldly roommate.(n)

programme.title: Network
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee about a mentally unstable news anchor who, after being told he's to be fired, becomes a media superstar when he begins delivering nightly rants and threatens an on-air suicide for his final broadcast. Paddy Chayevsky's script won an Oscar for Best Original Screenplay; Peter Firth received a posthumous Best Actor award as the unhinged newsman; and Faye Dunaway won Best Actress as a scheming network exec.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Bloody Sunday
programme.desc: A woman has a sexual relationship with a young bisexual sculptor who also carries on an intimate relationship with a doctor who is an acquaintance of the woman. The simmering tensions between the three bubble over when the woman and the artist agree to babysit for a couple that also knows all three of the people in this romantic triangle.(n)

programme.title: I Thank a Fool
programme.desc: An ex-doctor is charged with euthanasia in this tale of mystery and madness.(n)

programme.title: Stranger's Return
programme.desc: King Vidor's version of Phil Stong's novel about a woman (Miriam Hopkins) returning to her Midwestern family after years in New York. Lionel Barrymore. Guy: Franchot Tone. Nettie: Irene Hervey. Simon: Stuart Erwin. Beatrice: Beulah Bondi. Allen: Grant Mitchell. Excellent cast. Strong helped with the script.(n)

programme.title: The Richest Girl in the World
programme.desc: A rich woman swaps identities with her secretary in order to find out if she can trust a man she's about to begin dating after having been burned by fortune-hunters in the past.(n)

programme.title: Splendor
programme.desc: A tale of a woman (Miriam Hopkins) who marries into a once-wealthy family and is ill-used by her conniving in-laws. Joel McCrea. Martin: Paul Cavanagh. Mrs. Lorrimore: Helen Westley. Clarissa: Billie Burke. Martha: Katharine Alexander. Clancey: David Niven. Elliott Nugent directed.(n)

programme.title: Men Are Not Gods
programme.desc: Expertly acted story of extramarital love, with a theatrical background. Miriam Hopkins, Gertrude Lawrence. Tom: Rex Harrison. Katherine: Laura Smithson. Edmond: Sebastian Shaw. Producer: Val Gielgud. Skeates: A.E. Matthews. Walter Reisch directed.(n)

programme.title: Barbary Coast
programme.desc: Melodrama of brawling San Francisco in the early gold-rush days. Directed by Howard Hawks. Edward G. Robinson, Miriam Hopkins, Joel McCrea, Walter Brennan, Frank Craven, Brian Donlevy, Clyde Cook, Harry Carey, Donald Meek, Rollo Lloyd, J.M. Kerrigan. Lots of action; fine performances. Script by Ben Hecht and Charles MacArthur.(n)

programme.title: Virginia City
programme.desc: After escaping from a Confederate prison during the Civil War, a Union officer vows to stop a $5,000,000 gold shipment from reaching the South, but is challenged by a Southern sympathizer, whose interest in the gold is patriotic, and an outlaw, who just wants the bullion.(n)

programme.title: The Old Maid
programme.desc: Exceptional film version of the Pulitzer Prize play about an unwed woman in the mid-19th century whose illegitimate daughter is raised as her cousin's child.(n)

programme.title: Old Acquaintance
programme.desc: Two childhood friends both become writers, but each with a drastically different lifestyle: one remains single but becomes a critically acclaimed author, while the other gets married and writes pulp novels.(n)

programme.title: The Dark Knight Rises
programme.desc: In Gotham City, Bruce Wayne dons the Batman costume once again as the Dark Knight in order to battle Catwoman and Bane, a fierce foe possessed of tremendous physical and intellectual strength. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Blade Trinity
programme.desc: In this outing of the series, Blade has become a hated enemy of the bloodsucking community, and as they gather in their desert compound, a group of vampires plot to eliminate Blade once and for all by turning the mortal community against him. (cc).

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Booth's son, Parker, comes home from England, but Brennan wonders how he'll react to his new baby sister. Meanwhile, the discovery of a truck-company employee's corpse in the woods prompts a visit to the victim's son's karate class; and Hodgins goes on a shopping spree for lab equipment. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A corpse found in the woods may be connected to a feud between two families that's been going on for more than 100 years. Meanwhile, Max's offer to babysit his granddaughter, Christine, dredges up unpleasant memories for Brennan about her childhood. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: A film adaptation of Brennan's latest book takes her and Booth to Los Angeles for the production, where Brennan criticizes the acting and disregard for science, but the trip takes a strange turn when a prop cadaver happens to be a real murder victim. Meanwhile, Booth gets a job offer to work on the studio lot; and Cam's past comes back to haunt her. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A murder investigation uncovers a lawyer who's able to fix cases for high fees; and the DA wants to find the attorney's partner within the system. Harmon: David Marshall Grant Baker: Bruce MacVittie. Baez: Roger Pretto. Liriano: Jacinto Taras Riddick. Lisa: Alexandra Neil. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: An answering-machine message begins an investigation that leads to a teen (Sam Huntington) who claims to have set a fire that claimed the life of his stepsister. programme.desc: The series' second entry sends Austin Powers, the international man of mystery, zipping back in time to 1969 with his new sidekick, Felicity Shagwell, where nefarious Dr. Evil has stolen his "mojo," the life force that makes him a swinging ladies' man. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Mr. Mom
programme.desc: A laid-off auto engineer runs the household while his wife takes the role of breadwinner, and he ends up playing poker with the neighborhood housewives and considering infidelity with a dedicated homewrecker. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Verdict
programme.desc: An alcoholic lawyer thinks he can make some quick cash getting a settlement for the family of a woman who is in a coma after being operated on at a Catholic hospital. However, he becomes emotionally involved in the case, turns down the offer, and takes the powerful institution to court. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Snowman
programme.desc: Norwegian police detective Harry Hole hunts a terrifying adversary known as "the Snowman Killer." Hole and a rookie cop investigate cold cases in the hope of nabbing the killer, but they soon resort to more-desperate measures to catch their prey. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Runaway Jury
programme.desc: After a man dies in a shooting incident, his wife files a lawsuit against the company that manufactured the gun.The firearm manufacturer, taking no chances on the outcome of a potentially devastating case, hires a jury consultant who tries to guarantee a positive result for his clients. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Waitress
programme.desc: Charming tale of a pregnant small-town waitress (Keri Russell) hoping to win a pie-baking contest and leave her boorish husband. Adrienne Shelly wrote, directed and costars. Nathan Fillion, Cheryl Hines, Andy Griffith, Jeremy Sisto. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Girls Trip
programme.desc: Four gal pals decide they need to take a vacation together after five years apart, and head to New Orleans to have a wild time at the Essence Festival. There, they party hard while confronting their personal issues and romantic dilemmas. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Blade Runner 2049
programme.desc: In 2049 L.A., a cop known as K hunts down android laborers who have gone rogue. But when he uncovers a shocking conspiracy involving the robots, K searches for the one person who might have answers: a law-enforcement agent who once had his job. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: 17 Again
programme.desc: A former high-school basketball star gets a second shot at life after he's miraculously transformed back into a teenager. Back in high school, Mike O'Donnell was an MVP. But then Mike sacrificed everything in order to stay by his expectant girlfriend Scarlett. Twenty years later, Mike's life is falling apart when he's suddenly transported back into his teenage body and he discovers that by trying to recapture his best years, he could risk losing it all. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Waitress
programme.desc: Charming tale of a pregnant small-town waitress (Keri Russell) hoping to win a pie-baking contest and leave her boorish husband. Adrienne Shelly wrote, directed and costars. Nathan Fillion, Cheryl Hines, Andy Griffith, Jeremy Sisto. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Ouija Origin of Evil
programme.desc: In 1967 Los Angeles, a widow making ends meet as a psychic is stunned when she finds a Ouija board that actually enables her to talk to the dead. While it's great for business, the board also allows a vengeful ghost to possess her 9-year-old daughter. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Man on the Moon
programme.desc: Milos Forman ("One Flew over the Cuckoo's Nest") directed this biography about the zany life and times of actor-comedian Andy Kaufman. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: E.T. The Extra-Terrestrial
programme.desc: A lonely boy befriends a homesick alien stranded on Earth and attempts to help him find a way home. Meanwhile, a group of government scientists attempt to capture the benevolent visitor for research. Won Oscars for sound, visual effects and score. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Paradise
programme.desc: A 10-year-old spends a summer with an unhappy couple, who eventually come to care for the boy. The youngster becomes close friends with a classmate. Remake of the 1987 French film "Le Grand Chemin" ("The Big Road"). (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Hitman's Bodyguard
programme.desc: A professional bodyguard must protect his longtime nemesis, a ruthless hit man, after the latter agrees to testify at the Hague against a dictator. The bickering pair team up to defeat the dictator's henchmen as they embark on a journey across Europe. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The House
programme.desc: After realizing that they can't possibly afford the tuition for their daughter's college, a married couple team up with their eccentric neighbor to make money by running an illegal casino in the suburbs. Needless to say, things quickly spiral out of control as they deal with unruly guests while trying to keep their operation hidden from the police. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Held Up
programme.desc: An affable businessman (Jamie Foxx) gets stuck in the middle of a wacky hostage crisis inside a small-town convenience store. Rae: Nia Long. Pembry: Barry Corbin. Jack: John Cullum. Beaumont: Jake Busey. Rodrigo: Eduardo Yanez. Gloria: Julie Hagerty. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Shine
programme.desc: Geoffrey Rush won an Oscar for his portrayal of piano prodigy David Helfgott, whose domineering father (Armin Mueller-Stahl) caused him to have a mental breakdown. David (teen): Noah Taylor. Gillian: Lynn Redgrave. Prof. Parkes: John Gielgud. Directed by Scott Hicks. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Rachel
programme.desc: In this gothic romance set in 19th-century England, a young man falls for his alluring and secretive cousin Rachel, despite his suspicions that she murdered his guardian after altering the latter's will—or that she might be targeting him next. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Orphan
programme.desc: A seemingly angelic orphan named Esther exhibits an unforeseen devilish streak shortly after arriving at her new home. Devastated by a recent miscarriage, aspiring parents John and Kate decide to adopt 9-year-old Esther. But once she's welcomed into their family, she begins to display some deeply unsettling behavior. As tragedy looms, John and Kate race to convince everyone else that Esther is pure evil. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Geostorm
programme.desc: Two scientists race to avert a catastrophe when a series of climate-control satellites begin to malfunction. During their mission, they discover a conspiracy involving the satellites, which were designed to prevent natural disasters on Earth. (cc).

programme.title: The Book of Eli
programme.desc: Eli roams a postapocalyptic world, protecting a sacred tome that offers guidance on how to rebuild humanity. The evil Carnegie goes to great lengths to acquire the powerful book, but Carnegie's adopted daughter, who wants to escape her dad's clutches, helps Eli. (cc).

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: Bloody revenge saga about a disgraced intelligence agent-turned-bodyguard who becomes a one-man army when the girl he's protecting is kidnapped. (cc).

programme.title: Collateral
programme.desc: A character study-turned-thriller about a cabdriver who ferries a hit man on a late-night killing spree in Los Angeles. Foxx was nominated for Best Supporting Actor. (cc).

programme.title: Master Of The Drunken Fist Beggar So
programme.desc: Due to a conspiracy, wealthy So Chan loses everything. Saved by the Beggars' Sect, he learns the long lost martial art Drunken Fist to defeat the person who framed him. (cc).

programme.title: Extreme Measures
programme.desc: A brilliant emergency-room physician (Hugh Grant) stumbles across a doctor's diabolical experiment involving humans. Gene Hackman. Jodie: Sarah Jessica Parker. Hare: David Morse. Directed by Michael Apted. (cc).

programme.title: Caught in the Crossfire
programme.desc: Chris Klein and Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson star in director Brian A. Miller's drama about two detectives who become the targets of both gangsters and crooked cops during an important investigation. (cc).

programme.title: Darkman
programme.desc: After criminals blow up his lab and leave him for dead, a brilliant—but now terribly scarred—scientist exacts his revenge. Using synthetic skin he developed, he is able to assume the identities of many of the gang's key players. (cc).

programme.title: Happy Death Day
programme.desc: A college student is trapped in a time loop that forces her to keep reliving a birthday that ends with her murder at the hands of a masked madman. As she repeats the same day, she tries to figure out her killer's identity so she can avoid a grisly fate. (cc).

programme.title: Cradle 2 the Grave
programme.desc: A Taiwanese special agent teams up with a Los Angeles jewel thief after the latter's daughter is kidnapped. (cc).

programme.title: The Bourne Identity
programme.desc: An amnesiac CIA assassin tries to piece together his life as he is hunted for elimination by his superiors. (cc).

programme.title: Bad Company
programme.desc: When CIA agents Oakes and Pope try to secure a suitcase-sized nuke from a black-market dealer, they are ambushed and Pope is killed. Desperate for the bad guys to believe that Pope is still alive, Oakes recruits Pope's long-lost twin, a petty criminal. (cc).

programme.title: The Pink Panther
programme.desc: Hapless, hopeless and frenetically bumbling Inspector Jacques Clouseau rides again in this tale about a murder investigation involving a famous soccer coach and the search for a one-of-a-kind jewel called the "Pink Panther." (cc).

programme.title: Addicted to Love
programme.desc: Jilted lovers team up to seek revenge against their exes---and end up falling for each other. (cc).

programme.title: Swimming With Sharks
programme.desc: A recent film-school grad gets a dream job as a personal assistant to a Hollywood mogul, who not only tyrannizes him, but also takes credit for his script. (cc).

programme.desc: A dangerous fugitive threatens the town, as well as Rev. Anderson's sanity; Kyle struggles with a new understanding of where his powers – and his curse – originated; Megan and Holly try to rebuild their lives. (cc).

programme.title: The Client
programme.desc: An 11-year-old boy, who has witnessed a suicide, hires an attorney to protect himself and his family from mobsters. (cc).

programme.title: Happy Death Day
programme.desc: A college student is trapped in a time loop that forces her to keep reliving a birthday that ends with her murder at the hands of a masked madman. As she repeats the same day, she tries to figure out her killer's identity so she can avoid a grisly fate. (cc).

programme.title: The Midnight Meat Train
programme.desc: An ambitious photographer (Bradley Cooper) becomes obsessed with a hulking serial killer (Vinnie Jones) who preys on late-night subway riders. Based on a short story by Clive Barker. Leslie Bibb, Brooke Shields. (cc).

programme.title: Half Baked
programme.desc: Potheads scheme to bail their buddy out of jail by selling marijuana stolen from a research lab. (cc).

programme.title: Arachnophobia
programme.desc: A doctor in a small town discovers that a spate of recent deaths are due to lethal spiders that have spawned after being accidentally shipped there from South America. He fights the deadly creatures with the help of an outrageous exterminator. (cc).

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Best Picture winner is about a fictional romance between a struggling young playwright named Shakespeare and a noblewoman who longs to act, and who inspires him to write "Romeo and Juliet." Gwyneth Paltrow won an Oscar for her role as the muse. (cc).

programme.title: He's Just Not That Into You
programme.desc: Relationship go-round set in Baltimore, where an interconnected group of twenty-and-thirtysomething singles and marrieds try to get to the heart of what makes for true love. (cc).

programme.title: Surviving Christmas
programme.desc: A lonely ad exec (Ben Affleck) offers to pay the sullen owners of his childhood home to let him spend the holidays there. This uneven comedy lacks comfort and joy. James Gandolfini, Catherine O'Hara. Mike Mitchell directed. (cc).

programme.title: Get Out
programme.desc: While visiting his white girlfriend's family, an African-American man discovers that their seemingly idyllic community is hiding a sinister conspiracy—one that involves the disappearance of several black people in the area. (cc).

programme.title: Chaos
programme.desc: A criminal mastermind (Wesley Snipes) pulls a bank heist that turns into a hostage situation and demands to negotiate with a recently suspended police detective (Jason Statham) in this twist-filled caper. programme.title: The Wicker Man
programme.desc: A sheriff is contacted by his former fiancée, who claims that her daughter is missing. He travels to an island, where the girl was last seen, but finds that there is a sinister Wiccan community there blocking his investigation. (cc).

programme.title: John Wick Chapter 2
programme.desc: Hit man John Wick is once again called out of retirement, this time by a former colleague who wants him to repay a debt by killing an Italian crime lord. programme.title: A Walk in the Clouds
programme.desc: A GI poses as the husband of a pregnant student for the sake of her family. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: Suffering from writer's block, an unstable author is accused of plagiarism. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Kingdom of Heaven
programme.desc: A blacksmith joins the Crusades and tries to achieve peace between Muslims and Christians. Meanwhile, violent agitators on both sides foolishly strive to end the peace in a bid for greater power. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Kinsey
programme.desc: Provocative, intelligent biopic starring Liam Neeson as pioneering sex researcher Alfred Kinsey and Laura Linney as his freethinking wife. Chris O'Donnell, Peter Sarsgaard, Timothy Hutton, John Lithgow, Tim Curry. Directed by Bill Condon. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Hoffa
programme.desc: A biography of the Teamsters Union boss is told in flashbacks from his rise and fall as a labor reformer to his disappeared in 1975. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: A Russian gangster hires a mysterious, high-tech assassin (Bruce Willis) to kill a high-profile American citizen. Formulaic. Loosely based on the far superior 1973 film "The Day of the Jackal." Richard Gere, Sidney Poitier. Michael Caton-Jones directed. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Słoiki
programme.desc: Prawdzie historie ludzi, którzy przyjechali do Warszawy, by odmienić swoje życie. Mieszkańcy niewielkich miast i wsi liczą, że w stolicy uda im się zrealizować marzenia o lepszej pracy i pieniądzach. Nie łatwo jest im jednak odnaleźć się w wielkomiejskiej rzeczywistości.

programme.title: Dzień dobry
programme.desc: Poranne pasmo muzyczne, w którym prezentowane są najlepsze teledyski artystów cieszących się dużą popularnością.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.

programme.desc: Part 1 of two. Chandler's marriage proposal to Monica is interrupted by her ex-beau, Richard (Tom Selleck). Meanwhile, Joey gets a splashy surprise at a silent auction. (repeat).

programme.desc: Conclusion. Monica chooses her future groom, Chandler or Richard (Tom Selleck); Phoebe and Rachel talk “backup plans” in case they don't find Mr. Right. (repeat).

programme.title: Friends

programme.desc: A family crisis leads Christy and Bonnie to set aside their differences. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: George Lopez
